description:
doc: add Go's declaration syntax article

Originally published on The Go Programming Language Blog, July 7, 2010.

I did not put any go file in doc/progs. Shoul I include Go files
with those declarations?

http://blog.golang.org/2010/07/gos-declaration-syntax.html

Update issue 2547.

messages.text:
On 13 March 2012 13:48, Francisco Souza <franciscossouza@gmail.com> wrote:
> Sorry for the bad copy n paste and the horrible review, I will pay more
> attention next time :)

Thanks. It's particularly important with these documentation CLs
because there is no way we can machine format or check them. It's hard
to spot the issues in the wall of text.

doc: add Go's declaration syntax article

Originally published on The Go Programming Language Blog, July 7, 2010.

I did not put any go file in doc/progs. Shoul I include Go files
with those declarations?

http://blog.golang.org/2010/07/gos-declaration-syntax.html

Update issue 2547.

R=golang-dev, adg
CC=golang-dev
http://codereview.appspot.com/5795068

Committer: Andrew Gerrand <adg@golang.org>

http://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/2002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html
File doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html (right):

http://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/2002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html#newcode3
doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html:3: "Template": true
Drop this line, you don't use templates.

http://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/2002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html#newcode39
doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html:39: int *p; int a[3];
where are the newlines?

http://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/2002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html#newcode41
doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html:41: 
drop this blank line

http://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/2002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html#newcode55
doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html:55: int main(argc, argv) int argc; char *argv[]; { /* ... */ }
the formatting here is all wrong

http://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/2002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html#newcode57
doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html:57: 
ditto

https://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/6002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html File doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/6002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html#newcode115 doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html:115: so you drop the name from the *middle* of its declaration to construct replace the asterisks with

Hello golang-dev@googlegroups.com,

I'd like you to review this change to
https://code.google.com/p/go

ptal

Done.

doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html:39: int *p; int a[3];
On 2012/03/13 02:36:12, adg wrote:

Done.

https://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/2002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html#newcode55
doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html:55: int main(argc, argv) int argc; char *argv[]; { /* ... */ }
On 2012/03/13 02:36:12, adg wrote:
> the formatting here is all wrong

Done.

https://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/2002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html#newcode57
doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html:57: 
On 2012/03/13 02:36:12, adg wrote:
> ditto

Done.

Please take another look. https://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/6002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html File doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html (right): https://codereview.appspot.com/5795068/diff/6002/doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html#newcode115 doc/articles/gos_declaration_syntax.html:115: so you drop the name from the *middle* of its declaration to construct On 2012/03/13 03:07:31, adg wrote: > replace the asterisks with Done.
